MS MCQs

    Set up currencies and exchange rates in Dynamics 365 Business Central

    »

    1. What can you use a Currency Exchange Rate Service for with Business Central?

      For setting up currency exchange rates for service items.

      To keep the currency exchange rates in Business Central up-to-date by using an external service.

      To calculate the currency exchange rate differences for non-item related transactions.

      To enable the calculation of currency exchange rate differences.


    2. Which one of the following statements about the Fix Exchange Rate Amount field is true?

      When the Fix Exchange Rate Amount field is set to Currency on the Currency Exchange Rates page, it is possible to change the amount in the Sales (LCY) field on the Sales Invoice Statistics page.

      When the Fix Exchange Rate Amount field is set to Currency on the Currency Exchange Rates page, it is possible to change the amount in the Relational Exch. Rate Amount field on the Calc. Exchange Rates page of a sales order.

      When the Fix Exchange Rate Amount field is set to Relational Currency on the Currency Exchange Rates page, it is possible to change the amount in the Exchange Rate Amount field on the Change Exchange Rate page.

      When the Fix Exchange Rate Amount field is set to Both on the Currency Exchange Rates page, it is possible to change the amount in both the Amount and Amount (LCY) fields on the General Journal page so that the applicable exchange rate is calculated.
